meanings.definition: To lose or cause to lose luster, especially as a result of exposure to air or moisture.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the silver out in the open air can tarnish its shine.
meanings.sent2: The metal will tarnish if not polished regularly.
meanings.sent3: Why did the lazy squirrel tarnish its acorn collection by leaving them in the rain?
meanings.sent4: The once bright stars in the sky tarnish as the storm clouds roll in.
meanings.sent5: The princess's happiness began to tarnish when she realized her tiara was missing its sparkle.

meanings.definition: A film or layer of dirt or corrosion on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The antique mirror had a thin layer of tarnish that dulled its reflection.
meanings.sent2: She scrubbed the tarnish off the old coins to reveal their original shine.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat left a trail of tarnish on the polished floor after playing with a muddy toy.
meanings.sent4: The tarnish on the window glass distorted the view of the garden outside.
meanings.sent5: The tarnish on the doorknob made it difficult to turn and open the door.
